name: Tailored Cognitive Gaming Support
description: ALFRED provides personalized cognitive and physical game activities designed to engage older adults like Olivia and Elena, while respecting their privacy and interaction preferences. Caregivers and medical staff use the system to monitor progress and motivate participation without overwhelming the users.
scenario:
Olivia, a retired social worker, wakes up feeling a bit grumpy as usual. She’s skeptical about technology, especially when it comes to her privacy. When ALFRED suggests a cognitive game to start the day, Olivia immediately dismisses the notification, irritated by what she perceives as unnecessary interruptions. She insists on using the push-to-talk feature instead, quietly asking ALFRED to suggest a simple memory game she can play without sharing any data. Olivia’s voice is formal and curt—she makes it clear that she wants no unsolicited messages or video check-ins, and that her health data remain strictly private, even from her caregivers.

Meanwhile, in the neighboring city apartment, Elena is eager to begin her morning routine. She embraces ALFRED’s proactive encouragements to engage in more challenging physical and cognitive exercises. Elena enjoys the playful, informal tone ALFRED uses and doesn’t mind the system’s automatic activation to remind her to hydrate or stretch. She even looks forward to the video check-ins with her informal caregiver, Sarah, who often joins in on the games, cheering Elena on and sharing lighthearted banter. Elena feels motivated by the data ALFRED collects from her wearable sensors and the dynamic suggestions it offers, which helps her maintain her social life and physical health.

Sarah, juggling care responsibilities for multiple clients, appreciates ALFRED’s notifications about Elena’s progress and engages enthusiastically during their joint gaming sessions. She values the emotional connection these interactions foster, even if it means more notifications and some extra effort on her part. Sarah’s approach contrasts sharply with Mike Johnson, the registered nurse overseeing Olivia’s care. Mike respects Olivia’s privacy wishes and avoids non-critical alerts during his busy shifts. He uses ALFRED strictly for clinical data access, frustrated by any distractions from games or informal communication. Mike finds Olivia’s resistance to video check-ins challenging but respects her preference for offline contact, balancing professionalism with patience.

The tension between Olivia’s guarded, formal stance and Elena’s open, tech-friendly attitude reveals the complexity ALFRED must navigate. While Elena thrives with active encouragement and social gaming, Olivia remains cautious, insisting on control and minimal intrusion. Sarah embraces ALFRED’s social features to strengthen bonds, whereas Mike prioritizes clinical efficiency and respects boundaries, highlighting the system’s delicate role in tailoring care and engagement to each individual’s unique needs and comfort levels.
